## Description {#details}

Defines the fixed point number interface.

This is a class for abstracting various operations performed on fixed point types.

<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Returns true if this fixed-point semantic with its value bits interpreted</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// as an integer can fit in the given floating point semantic without</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For example, a signed 8-bit fixed-point semantic has a maximum and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// minimum integer representation of 127 and -128, respectively. If both of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// these values can be represented (possibly inexactly) in the floating</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// point semantic without overflowing, this returns true.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The APFixedPoint class works similarly to APInt/APSInt in that it is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// functional replacement for a scaled integer. It supports a wide range of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// semantics including the one used by fixed point types proposed in ISO/IEC</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// JTC1 SC22 WG14 N1169. The class carries the value and semantics of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a fixed point, and provides different operations that would normally be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// performed on fixed point types.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfixedpoint"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfixedpoint/#a17de6476b95be00e26e2a67b4bdd105f">APFixedPoint</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">      : Val(Val, !Sema.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfixedpoint/#a9a5c35033396ab686cf586ebdd083dbe">isSigned</a>()), Sema(Sema) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
